dt: {bc}the bodily or mental capacity to sustain a prolonged stressful effort or activity {bc}{sx|endurance||}

dt.t: a workout program that builds strength and {wi}stamina{/wi}
These horses are bred for speed and {wi}stamina{/wi}.
The use of pharmaceuticals to enhance memory, focus, and mental {wi}stamina{/wi} in healthy brains is known generally as cognitive enhancement …

dt: {bc}the moral or emotional strength to continue with a difficult process, effort, etc. {bc}{sx|staying power||}

dt.t: The network of obligations to family and community underpinned the soldier's moral {wi}stamina{/wi} …

et: Latin, plural of {it}stamen{/it} warp, thread of life spun by the Fates
shortdef: the bodily or mental capacity to sustain a prolonged stressful effort or activity : endurance
the moral or emotional strength to continue with a difficult process, effort, etc. : staying power

dt: {bc}the pollen-producing male organ of a flower that consists of an anther and a filament {dx}see {dxt|flower|flower|illustration}{/dx}

et: Latin, warp, thread, from {it}stare{/it} to stand {ma}{mat|stand|}{/ma}
shortdef: a microsporophyll of a seed plant; specifically : the pollen-producing male organ of a flower that consists of an anther and a filament
